powergrid.control

Class IOHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • powergrid.control.IOHandler

  • public class IOHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles basic I/O functions, such as writing and reading from files and moving or copying files.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void copy(java.io.File origin, java.io.File destination)
      Copies a File using Java NIO FileChannels.
      static java.lang.String read(java.io.File origin)
      Reads a File from the specified location and returns the result as a String.
      static void write(java.io.File destination, java.lang.String data)
      Writes the given Object's String value to the given File.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public static void copy(java.io.File origin,
        java.io.File destination)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Copies a File using Java NIO FileChannels.

        This is generally the fastest way to copy files, but it will be blocked by a SecurityManager if the SecurityManager does not allow reading/writing to the given Files.

        Parameters:
        origin - the File to copy from
        destination - the File to copy to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the copy failed

      • write

        public static void write(java.io.File destination,
         java.lang.String data)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the given Object's String value to the given File.

        The write can be blocked by a SecurityManager

        Parameters:
        destination - the destination to write to
        data - the Object to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the data could not be written

      • read

        public static java.lang.String read(java.io.File origin)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a File from the specified location and returns the result as a String.

        A SecurityException may be thrown if a SecurityManager does not allow access to the given File.

        Parameters:
        origin - the File to read from
        Returns:
        the result String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when the read operation failed.
